intro: Angraecum guillauminii, commonly known as the Guillaumin's orchid, is a rare and striking epiphytic orchid native to Madagascar. It features long, slender stems and produces large, fragrant, white flowers with intricate patterns. The plant is characterized by its ability to bloom at night, a trait that aligns with its pollination by the hawkmoth. Its leaves are typically dark green and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture in its native habitat. Angraecum guillauminii is highly sought after by orchid enthusiasts due to its beauty and rarity.
